safety.title: Security notice
safety.description: We have observed malicious third-party skills in the wild. Always review the source code before installing, and prefer official or audited community skills.

longform.title: What OpenClaw Is and Why It Matters Now
longform.subtitle: If you are looking for a self-hosted, extensible, and maintainable AI platform, OpenClaw offers a clearer path and a safer choice.

sections.title: Origin and goal
paragraphs: OpenClaw started as a weekend project, but the goal was always clear: make a self-hosted AI assistant available to everyone. OpenClaw chooses the open path because tools should be inspectable, replaceable, and portable.
OpenClaw does not lock your data into a black box. You can run OpenClaw on your own laptop, home server, or cloud, and reach your team through the chat apps you already use.

sections.title: Installation philosophy
paragraphs: OpenClaw is not tied to a single install path: quick local trials, cloud server deployment, Docker containers, and K8s clusters are all supported. OpenClaw turns complexity into readable guides so you can choose what fits.
If you just want to validate value in 10 minutes, OpenClaw provides the shortest path. If you need production-grade stability, OpenClaw also offers a more complete deployment plan.

sections.title: How OpenClaw works
paragraphs: OpenClaw runs on infrastructure you choose, yet works through WhatsApp, Telegram, Discord, Slack, and more. OpenClaw keeps model capability close to the business context.
OpenClaw is not a single tool, but a composable capability set: model routing, knowledge integration, permission control, and tool execution. OpenClaw makes automation traceable and reversible.

sections.title: Security and data ownership
paragraphs: OpenClaw defaults to least privilege and auditability. OpenClaw lets you keep keys on your own infrastructure to avoid exposing sensitive data to third parties.

Prompt injection remains an industry-wide problem, so OpenClaw bakes security reminders into the workflow to help you build safer configurations. OpenClaw continues to strengthen its security baseline.

highlights.title: Key OpenClaw benefits
items: Supports multiple installation paths with clear migration routes.
Runs on your own machines and networks; data stays inside.
Built for team collaboration and permission control.
Skills are extensible, auditable, and easy to customize.

items.q: Is OpenClaw for individuals or teams?
items.a: OpenClaw fits both solo developers and teams. You can start locally and scale as needed.

items.q: How is OpenClaw different from SaaS assistants?
items.a: OpenClaw runs on infrastructure you choose. You keep your data and keys, with more flexible deployment options.
We provide tiered guides from local to cloud, so beginners can finish quickly.
OpenClaw supports multi-model access and routing, and can be extended to fit your needs.
